gurmukhi: ਜਾਲਮ ਜਮਾਲ ਖੂਬੀ ॥ ਰੋਸਨ ਦਿਮਾਗ ਅਖਤਰ ॥ ਪੁਰ ਚੁਸਤ ਜਾਂ ਜਿਗਰ ਰਾ ॥ ਵਹ ਗੁਲ ਚਿਹਰ ਕਹਾਂ ਹੈ ॥੬੬੪॥
transliteration: Jaalam Jamaal Khoobee|| Rosan Dimaag Akhtar|| Pur Choust Jaan Jigad Raa|| Vah Gul Chiihar Kahaan Hai||664||
translation: “The splendour of this face was significant and he was perfect in intellect; he, who is a vessel full of the wine of heart’s love, where is that flower faced Ram?664.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਲਮ ਬਿਦੇਸ ਅਾੲੇ ॥ ਜੀਤੇ ਜੁਅਾਨ ਜਾਲਮ ॥ ਕਾਮਲ ਕਮਾਲ ਸੂਰਤ ॥ ਵਰ ਗੁਲ ਚਿਹਰ ਕਹਾਂ ਹੈ ॥੬੬੫॥
transliteration: Baalam Bides Aae|| Jeete Juaan Jaalam|| Kaamal Kamaal Soorat|| Vah Gul Chihar Kahaan Hai||665||
translation: “After conquering the tyrants the beloved Ram has come back from distant lands; where is he, the perfect one in all arts and who hath flower-like face?665.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਸਨ ਜਹਾਨ ਖੂਬੀ ॥ ਜਾਹਰ ਕਲੀਮ ਹਫਤ ਜਿ ॥ ਅਾਲਮ ਖੁਸਾੲਿ ਜਲਵਾ ॥ ਵਹ ਗੁਲ ਚਿਹਰ ਕਹਾਂ ਹੈ ॥੬੬੬॥
transliteration: Rosan Jahaan Khoobee|| Jaahar Kaleem Haft Ji|| Aalam Khousaae Jalvaa|| Vah Gul Chihar Kahaan Hai|| 666||
translation: “His qualities are known all over the world and he is famous in the seven regions of the world; he whose light hath spread throughout the world, where is that flower-faced Ram?666.

gurmukhi: ਜੀਤੇ ਬਜੰਗ ਜਾਲਮ ॥ ਕੀਨ ਖਤੰਗ ਪਰਰਾ ॥ ਪੁਹਪਕ ਬਿਬਾਨ ਬੈਠੇ ॥ ਸੀਤਾ ਰਵਨ ਕਹਾਂ ਹੈ ॥੬੬੭॥
transliteration: Jeete Bajan Jaalam|| Keen Khatan Par-raa|| Puhpak Bibaan Baithaa|| Sitaa Ravan Kahaan Hai||667||
translation: “He who conquered the tyrants with the blows of his arrows; where is he who mouth the air-vehicle Pushapak and accompanies Sita?667.

gurmukhi: ਮਾਦਰ ਖੁਸਾਲ ਖਾਤਰ ॥ ਕੀਨੇ ਹਜਾਰ ਛਾਵਰ ॥ ਮਾਤੁਰ ਸਿਤਾ ਬਧਾੲੀ ॥ ਵਹ ਗੁਲ ਚਿਹਰ ਕਹਾਂ ਹੈ ॥੬੬੮॥
transliteration: Maadar Khousaal Khaatar|| Keene Hajaar Chhaadar|| Maatur Sitaa Badhaaee|| Vah Gul Chihar Kahaan Hai||668||
translation: “He who sacrificed thousands of his joys in order to please his mother, where is he? The mother Sita may also be congratulate today, but someone may tell us where is that flower-faced Ram?”668.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਤਿ ਸ੍ਰੀ ਰਾਮ ਅਵਤਾਰ ਸੀਤਾ ਅਯੁਧਿਅਾ ਅਾਗਮ ਨਾਮ ਧਿਅਾੲਿ ਸਮਾਪਤੰ ॥
transliteration: It(i) Sriraam Avtaar Seetaa Ayudhiaa Aagad Dhiaae Samaapatan||
translation: End of the Chapter entitled ‘The Entry of Sita in Ayodhya’ in Ramvatar.
Now begins the description of the Meeting with the Mother :

gurmukhi: ਸੁਨੇ ਰਾਮ ਅਾੲੇ ॥ ਸਭੈ ਲੋਗ ਧਾੲੇ ॥ ਲਗੇ ਅਾਨ ਪਾਯੰ ॥ ਮਿਲੇ ਰਾਮ ਰਾਯੰ ॥੬੬੯॥
transliteration: Soune Raam Aae|| Sabhai Log Dhaae|| Lage Aan Paayan|| Mile Ram Raayan||669||
translation: When the people heard that Ram had returned, then all the people ran and fell at his feet; Ram met all of them.669.

gurmukhi: ਕੋੳੂ ਚੳੁਰ ਢਾਰੈਂ ॥ ਕੋੳੂ ਪਾਨ ਖੁਅਾਰੈਂ ॥ ਪਰੇ ਮਾਤ ਪਾਯੰ ॥ ਲੲੇ ਕੰਠ ਲਾਯੰ ॥੬੭੦॥
transliteration: Ko( i)  Chaur Dhdarain|| Ko( i)  Paan Khudarain|| Dare Maat Paayan|| Lae Kanth Laayan||670||
translation: Someone swung she fly-whisk, someone offered the betel; Ram fell at the feet of his mother and his mothers hugged him to their bosom.670.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਲੈ ਕੰਠ ਰੋਵੈਂ ॥ ਮਨੋ ਸੋਕ ਧੋਵੈਂ ॥ ਕਰੈਂ ਬੀਰ ਬਾਤੈਂ ॥ ਸੁਨੇ ਸਰਬ ਮਾਤੈਂ ॥੬੭੧॥
transliteration: Milai Kanth Rovain|| Manos Ok Dhovain|| Darain Beer Baatain|| Soune Sarab Maatain||671||
translation: On being hugged he was weeping in order to wash away all his suffering; the brave Ram began to talk and all the mothers listened.671.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਲੈ ਲੱਛ ਮਾਤੰ ॥ ਪਰੇ ਪਾੲਿ ਭ੍ਰਾਤੰ ॥ ਕਰਿਯੋ ਦਾਨ ੲੇਤੋ ॥ ਗਨੈ ਕੳੁਨ ਕੇਤੋ ॥੬੭੨॥
transliteration: Mile Lachchh Maatan|| Dare Paae Bhraatan|| Kariyo Daan Eto|| Gadai Kaoun Keto||672||
translation: Then he met the mother of Lakshman and the brother Bharat and Shatrughan touched his feet. On account of the joy of union, unaccountable charity was given.672.

gurmukhi: ਮਿਲੇ ਭਰਥ ਮਾਤੰ ॥ ਕਹੀ ਸਰਬ ਬਾਤੰ ॥ ਧਨੰ ਮਾਤ ਤੋ ਕੋ ॥ ਅਰਿਣੀ ਕੀਨ ਮੋਕੋ ॥੬੭੩॥
transliteration: Mile Bharath Maatan|| Kahisarab Baatan|| Dhanan Maat To Ko|| Arinikeen Moko||673||
translation: Then Ram met the mother of Bharat and told her all that happened with him; Ram said, “O mother, I am thankful to you because you have made me free from indebtedness.673.

gurmukhi: ਕਹਾ ਦੇਸ ਤੇਰੈ ॥ ਲਿਖੀ ਲੋਖ ਮੇਰੈ ॥ ਹੁਨੀ ਹੋ ਸੁ ਹੋੲੀ ॥ ਕਹੈ ਕੳੁਨ ਕੋੲੀ ॥੬੭੪॥
transliteration: Kahaa Dos Terai|| Likhilekh Merai|| Houniho Su Hoee|| Kahai Kaoun Kaee||674||
translation: “You are not to be blamed for this, because it was recorded in my destiny, whatever happens, has to happen, none can describe it.”674.
